original_title: Sri Lanka rupee stronger against dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 302.10/15 to the US dollar in the spot market Wednesday, stronger from 302.12/20 the previous day, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.15/25 percent, down from 8.20/28 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted at 9.00/05 percent, down from 9.00/9.08 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.51/55 percent, down from 9.52/66 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.35/45 percent, up from 10.35/40 percent.
Rs 74,000 million Treasury bills were being issued through an auction.
The Colombo Stock Exchange was trading down; the ASPI was down 0.02 percentat 20,986, whilethe S&P SL20 was down 0.08 percent at 6,022. (Colombo/Sep3/2025)
